--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Joseph Reisinger <joeraii@c...> wrote:
> > By the way if anyone has any suggestions for the neuroevolution
domain
> > I'd be happy to hear them.
> 
> What about something similar to evoweb?
> 
> http://evonet.dcs.napier.ac.uk/
> 
> Except more geared towards NE. You could setup some kind of
centralized
> repository for information about groups working in neuro-evolution.
This
> would really help in the process of moving neuro-evolution from an
> academic pursuit more into the mainstream.
> 

That sounds like a good idea (as is Derek's later suggestion of having
a domain repository).  There are two things stopping me from doing
this right now:

-I'm not sure if the NE community is currently big enough to support
such a site, or to need such a site.  Certainly NE is not as big as
evolutionary computation in general, and although NE is growing, I'm
not sure what the demand would be in the present.

-I don't know if I have time to run such a site...evonet looks like a
pretty time=consuming project.  I doubt I can maintain it on my own.

That said, at some point I would like to have such a site for NE.

ken
